alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Knott; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 6:28AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Martin, northeastern Knott, central Floyd and northern Pike Counties through 715 AM EST... At 627 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Langley, or 11 miles south of Prestonsburg, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Aluba, Justell, Harold, Ivel, Grethel, Osborn and Galveston around 635 AM EST. Pikeville, Betsy Layne, Boldman and Coal Run around 640 AM EST. Coal Run Village, Gulnare, Zebulon and McCombs around 645 AM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Meta, Piso, Jarad, Heenan, Raccoon, Sidney, Varney, Heisey, Conder, Kimper, Forest Hills, Canada, Belfry, Huddy, Turkey Creek, Mcandrews, Rural, Whitepost, Hardy, Aflex, Phelps and Board Tree. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
